title: Eleanor Rigby
notes: String-driven chamber pop; low danceability; somber narrative.

title: What a Wonderful World
notes: Slow jazz-pop standard; gentle low energy and non-dance but very warm, hopeful high-valence tone.

title: Here Comes the Sun
notes: Bright acoustic pop; gentle steady groove; very positive tone.

title: Ain't No Sunshine
notes: Minimal soul ballad; sparse arrangement clearly low energy and non-dance emotionally heavy.

title: Lean on Me
notes: Soul/gospel ballad; slow supportive groove, emotionally uplifting with big singalong chorus but not a dance record.

title: Dancing Queen
notes: Archetypal disco-pop; joyful very danceable clearly high energy/high valence.

title: Hotel California
notes: Classic rock epic; long-running structure; bittersweet mood.

title: September
notes: Classic disco-funk; relentlessly upbeat and danceable archetypal hi-energy/hi-dance/hi-valence party cut.

title: Stayin' Alive
notes: Signature 70s disco groove; relentless pulse very strong dance feel.

title: Billie Jean
notes: Groove-based pop; archetypal mid-tempo hit.

title: Africa
notes: Classic soft-rock/pop; steady groove not hyper or sleepy—very “true mid” on both energy and dance.

title: Girls Just Want to Have Fun
notes: Iconic 80s pop; very high-energy high-valence dance track.

title: When Doves Cry
notes: Sparse experimental but huge mainstream hit.

title: Take On Me
notes: Fast 80s synth-pop; perceived ~84.5 in half-time.

title: Everybody Wants to Rule the World
notes: Laid-back 80s pop-rock; mid energy mid danceability reflective tone.

title: Livin' on a Prayer
notes: Arena rock anthem; big chorus lift.

title: Sweet Child o' Mine
notes: Rock hit with iconic riff; long-form structure.

title: With or Without You
notes: Slow-building rock ballad; hypnotic groove; yearning tone.

title: I Wanna Dance With Somebody (Who Loves Me)
notes: High-energy high-valence dance-pop.

title: Like a Prayer
notes: Gospel-infused pop; emotional but uplifting; album version used in benchmark.

title: It Must Have Been Love
notes: Power ballad; slow tempo; emotionally heavy; not dance-focused.

title: Nothing Compares 2 U
notes: Iconic heartbreak ballad; extremely sparse and emotionally heavy. Archetypal low-energy, low-dance, low-valence reference.

title: I Can't Make You Love Me
notes: Piano-led adult-contemporary ballad; extremely intimate, low-energy, non-dance and emotionally devastating.

title: Smells Like Teen Spirit
notes: Grunge rock anthem; very high energy with mid danceability and brooding anthemic tone.

title: End of the Road
notes: Early-90s R&B slow jam; big vocal swells but overall slow sway-not-dance heartbreak-heavy.

title: Creep
notes: Alt-rock ballad; quiet loud dynamic; emotionally dark and self-loathing.

title: Hero
notes: Big vocal power ballad; slow tempo; inspirational but solemn tone.

title: Fantasy
notes: Mid-tempo R&B-pop; sweet upbeat feel.

title: Wonderwall
notes: Anthemic Britpop; strummy mid-energy.

title: Wannabe
notes: Bouncy girl-group pop; short hooky.

title: My Heart Will Go On
notes: Titanic power ballad; very slow big emotional build.

title: The Boy Is Mine
notes: Late-90s R&B-pop duet; mid tempo groove-based emotionally tense but not dark.

title: ...Baby One More Time
notes: Turn-of-era teen pop; strong hook mid-tempo.

title: I Want It That Way
notes: Boy-band ballad-ish pop; mid energy big chorus.

title: No Scrubs
notes: R&B-pop crossover; groove-led.

title: Yellow
notes: Alt-pop ballad; steady build emotional.

title: Complicated
notes: Early-2000s pop-rock; strummy mid-tempo more head-bob than dancefloor emotionally neutral-to-bittersweet.

title: Crazy in Love
notes: Horn-driven R&B-pop; very high energy and danceability.

title: Bring Me to Life
notes: Rock/nu-metal crossover; big dynamic hits and high energy with a clear groove but dark, dramatic low-valence mood.

title: Hey Ya!
notes: Quirky funk-pop; very fast but feels infectious and fun.

title: Since U Been Gone
notes: Pop-rock belter; high energy breakup anthem.

title: Yeah!
notes: Club R&B; heavy low-end and high danceability.

title: Hips Don't Lie
notes: Latin-pop crossover; high groove and danceability; 2006 album version in benchmark.

title: Umbrella
notes: Dark mid-tempo R&B-pop; big chorus hook.

title: Viva La Vida
notes: Anthemic orchestral pop; rolling rhythm but emotionally bittersweet mid-valence.

title: Poker Face
notes: Electro-pop banger; club-oriented energy.

title: Disturbia
notes: Dark electro-pop club track; very high energy and danceability but eerie, tense low-valence feel.

title: I Gotta Feeling
notes: Huge party anthem; very high energy and danceability; feel-good chorus.

title: Rolling in the Deep
notes: Bluesy pop; strong vocal stomping groove.

title: Firework
notes: Anthemic pop; big builds and explosive chorus, clearly hi-energy/hi-dance/hi-valence empowerment record.

title: Someone Like You
notes: Piano/vocal breakup ballad; archetypal low energy very low danceability emotionally devastating.

title: Somebody That I Used to Know
notes: Sparse indie-pop ballad; mid energy but emotionally downbeat and melancholic.

title: When I Was Your Man
notes: Piano ballad; sparse arrangement; emotionally regretful; non-dance.

title: Call Me Maybe
notes: Modern bubblegum pop classic; bouncy and bright obvious hi-energy/hi-dance.

title: Get Lucky
notes: Sleek disco-funk; smooth but absolutely a dancefloor record strong steady groove.

title: Royals
notes: Minimalist alt-pop; very sparse low-band energy.

title: Sweater Weather
notes: Alt-pop mid-tempo groove; moody tone; subtly danceable.

title: One Last Time
notes: Mid-tempo EDM-pop ballad; big chorus but not a club banger sits comfortably in the middle.

title: Uptown Funk
notes: Retro-funk pastiche; long but massive groove.

title: Happy
notes: Uptempo feel-good soul-pop; very high valence.

title: Stay With Me
notes: Gospel-tinged ballad; slow emotional delivery; low danceability.

title: Chandelier
notes: Soaring pop ballad over trap-influenced drums; vocally intense high energy but emotionally heavy with low-valence subject matter.

title: Shake It Off
notes: Maximalist pop; very high energy and valence.

title: Style
notes: Cool mid-tempo pop; driving but not a club banger, strong mid-band reference.

title: Hello
notes: Piano-led power ballad; slow build; heavy emotional weight; non-dance.

title: Love Yourself
notes: Minimal acoustic pop; low energy and danceability with lightly snarky tone.

title: One Dance
notes: Afro-dancehall-inflected pop; mid energy very danceable moody but not dark.

title: CAN'T STOP THE FEELING!
notes: Uplifting disco-funk pop; designed as a feel-good family dance track with clearly high energy, high danceability and high valence.

title: Closer
notes: EDM-pop with mellow energy; streaming-era staple.

title: Best Part
notes: Modern neo-soul slow jam; intimate super low energy and dance but warm/mid valence rather than tragic.

title: Shape of You
notes: Caribbean-inflected pop; heavy on groove with mid valence.

title: Believer
notes: Arena/pop rock anthem; very high energy with a strong but not club-focused groove, emotionally intense but ultimately uplifting.

artist: Luis Fonsi & Daddy Yankee feat. Justin Bieber
title: Despacito (Remix)
notes: Reggaeton-pop crossover; rhythmic sensual.

title: One Kiss
notes: House-pop; club-focused hi-dance cut with a cool mid-valence feel.

title: Happier
notes: Sad-pop mid-tempo; bounce in the drums but emotional tone is clearly down strong “mid” energy with low-ish valence.

title: Better Now
notes: Mid-tempo emo-rap pop; steady groove; bittersweet reflective tone.

title: bad guy
notes: Minimal off-kilter pop; quirky cool rather than bright.

title: Don't Start Now
notes: Nu-disco pop; high-energy and very danceable.

title: Someone You Loved
notes: Piano ballad; emotionally raw vocal; minimal groove; non-dance.

title: Dynamite
notes: Disco-pop; very bright high-valence.

title: Levitating
notes: Another nu-disco cut; strong groove and fun tone.

title: Watermelon Sugar
notes: Summery retro-pop; bright high-energy feel; very singalong and fun.

title: Blinding Lights
notes: Feels like ~85.5 BPM double-time; retro synthwave pop.

title: Kiss Me More
notes: Playful disco-pop; high energy very danceable bright flirtatious tone.

title: Pepas
notes: EDM/reggaeton party anthem; archetypal festival hi-energy, hi-dance, euphoric feel.

title: drivers license
notes: Slow emotional ballad; breakup narrative.

title: End of Beginning
notes: Indie pop rock; driving mid energy; nostalgic bittersweet feel.

title: Heat Waves
notes: Alt-pop slow-burn; hazy mid valence.

title: As It Was
notes: Feels like ~87 BPM double-time; bittersweet pop.

title: Bad Habit
notes: Laid-back alt R&B; loping mid energy; strong head-nod groove.

title: Flowers
notes: Mid-tempo self-empowerment pop; steady groove.

title: Lose Control
notes: Soulful belter; strong vocal intensity; mid-tempo band groove.

title: Water
notes: Afro-pop club track; very danceable; sensual mid-valence tone.

title: BIRDS OF A FEATHER
notes: Dreamy indie-pop; floating mid energy; mid danceability and mood.

title: Too Sweet
notes: Groovy alt-soul; swung mid energy; subtly danceable; wry tone.

title: Not Like Us
notes: West Coast club rap; very high energy; very danceable; aggressive but fun.

title: Espresso
notes: Uptempo pop; very punchy groove; playful high-valence tone.

title: Please Please Please
notes: Mid-tempo pop; steady rhythmic feel; playful yet slightly tense mood.

title: Fortnight
notes: Moody synth-pop; mid energy; low-valence bittersweet tone; subtle groove.

title: Ordinary
notes: Heartfelt 2025 summer ballad; moderate tempo, steady build, emotionally romantic but more intimate than euphoric.
